CatDescriptText: UNVERIFIED CUT LINE - "THE WAY IT WAS - Harvey Adams Jr. was one of the principal founders of the Guardians, the Pittsburgh area association of African-American law enforcement officers. Adams, currently director of the Housing Authority, city of Pittsburgh Police Dept.., proudly displays photo of Black cops in the 1950s. From left are: Adams' former partner John Daniels, who died recently, Officer John Har[r]ell, Lt. Mac Henderson (deceased), Officer Raymond Hood (deceased), Adams himself, Lt. Karl Jackson (deceased) and Officer Delmus Orme (deceased).
TitMainTitle: Seven police officers, from left to right including John Daniels, John Harrell, Lt. Mac Henderson, Raymond Hood, Harvey Adams, Lt. Karl Jackson and Delmus Orme,  posed in front of New Granada Theater, with poster for "The Stranger Wore a Gun," Centre Avenue, Hill District
